title: Can a civil court default judgement on debt collection affect application for US citizenship ?
question: I would like to know if a 10-year old default judgment by a US Civil Court on credit card debt collection affect the future application for US citizenship ? The defendant was not a US resident at the time of judgment.
question_tags: Immigration,US citizenship,Immigrants and credit cards,Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes,Default judgment,Civil court
answers: No, the only debt that may affect any immigration benefits is a medical debt to a public hospital. Hope this perspective helps!
